channel.title: Yahoo! News: Top Stories
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2011 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved.

item.title: Rebels retreat from Libyan oil port amid barrage (AP)
item.description: AP - With fierce barrages of tank and artillery fire, Moammar Gadhafi's loyalists threw rebels into a frantic retreat from a strategic oil port Thursday in a counteroffensive that reversed the opposition's advance toward the capital of Tripoli and now threatens its positions in the east.

item.title: Wis. defeat could help launch counterattack on GOP (AP)
item.description: AP - With the labor movement suffering an epic defeat in Wisconsin, union leaders plan to use the setback to fire up their members nationwide and mount a major counterattack against Republicans at the ballot box in 2012.

item.title: Republicans planning cost curbs on health benefits (AP)
item.description: AP - House Republicans will "lead with our chin" and offer politically explosive cost curbs this spring on programs like Medicare, Medicaid and perhaps Social Security, the party's point man for curbing crippling budget deficits said Thursday.

item.title: Top intel official in hot water over blunt remarks (AP)
item.description: AP - The government's top intelligence official fumbled the Obama administration's message Thursday about embattled Moammar Gadhafi's fate, telling Congress that the Libyan leader will prevail in his fight with rebel forces there. It was the latest in a series of public gaffes for James Clapper, the director of national intelligence.

item.title: Stocks plunge on economic news, oil price swings (AP)
item.description: AP - Just when Americans put aside their fears and started buying stocks again, here come a host of reminders of why they left.

item.title: Giffords hopes to attend husband's shuttle launch (AP)
item.description: AP - Rep. Gabrielle Giffords has shown so much progress in her recovery from a bullet wound to the head that friends and family are making plans for her to attend the launch of her husband's space shuttle mission next month in Florida, a person close to the family told The Associated Press on Thursday.

item.title: Obama to bullying victims: I know what it's like (AP)
item.description: AP - President Barack Obama smiled when he said his large ears and funny name once made him a target of school-yard harassment. But he was all seriousness Thursday when he told a White House conference on bullying that torment and intimidation must not be tolerated.

item.title: Study: Coffee tied to lower stroke risk in women (AP)
item.description: AP - Women who enjoy a daily dose of coffee may like this perk: It might lower their risk of stroke.

item.title: Sheen files $100 million suit against Warner Bros. (AP)
item.description: AP - Charlie Sheen brought his verbal war against Warner Bros. and the executive producer of "Two and a Half Men" to the courtroom on Thursday, filing a $100 million lawsuit seeking to recoup his salary and wages for the show's cast and crew.

item.title: Heat snap 5-game slide, top Lakers 94-88 (AP)
item.description: AP - Less than 2 minutes to go, tie game, Kobe Bryant with the basketball and staring down Dwyane Wade.

item.title: Wisconsin passes anti-union law in labor rebuke (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - The Wisconsin state Assembly on Thursday approved sweeping restrictions on public sector unions in a stinging rebuke of the labor movement that critics fear will encourage other states to follow.

item.title: Gaddafi threatens offensive, ignores diplomatic moves (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi's son told rebels on Thursday they faced a full-scale assault to crush their three-week-old uprising as troops, tanks and warplanes punched into the rebel-held east of the country.

item.title: House panel delves into Muslims radicalization (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Muslim Americans must do more to combat Islamic radicalization as al Qaeda targets them to help carry out terrorism plots, a lawmaker said on Thursday as he convened hearings critics said unfairly singled out Muslims.

item.title: No consensus seen in Congress for U.S. Libya action (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - As the Obama administration wrestles over what to do about Libya, the voices on Capitol Hill offer no consensus on military action.

item.title: Rajaratnam paid for tips, ex-McKinsey man testifies (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - A disgraced former McKinsey & Co partner told jurors he leaked secrets about the elite consulting firm's clients in exchange for $1.75 million in hidden payments from onetime friend Raj Rajaratnam, the main defendant in the biggest U.S. insider trading trial in years.

item.title: Egypt apologizes for security police "violations": report (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Egypt's interior minister said the state security apparatus will be restricted to combating terrorism and espionage and he apologized for past 'violations'. the official state news agency MENA reported Thursday.

item.title: Budget deficit hits record $222.5 billion in February (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - The government posted a record monthly budget deficit of $222.5 billion in February as spending growth outstripped revenue gains crimped by tax cuts enacted late last year, the Treasury Department reported on Thursday.

item.title: Household wealth jumps $2.1 trillion in last quarter (Reuters)
item.description: Reuters - Household wealth rose by $2.1 trillion in the fourth quarter and their debt contracted at the slowest pace since 2008 as consumers stepped up spending and boosted the fragile economic recovery.

item.title: Kadhafi son says 'victory in sight' as West frets (AFP)
item.description: AFP - Moamer Kadhafi's son said on Thursday victory was in sight against rebels fighting his father's iron-fisted regime after loyalist forces retook two key towns and Western powers fretted over how to deal with the civil war while tightening the screws further.

item.title: West heads divided into pivotal Libya crisis talks (AFP)
item.description: AFP - Western powers head into pivotal Libya crisis talks Friday divided over a British-French push for formal recognition of Moamer Kadhafi's opponents and a Paris plea for limited airstrikes.
